Menag: Hasil Survei, 52 Persen Pelajar Setuju Radikalisme
06 Nov 2019, 20:57 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi. (CNN Indonesia/ Feri Agus Setyawan).

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Menteri Agama (Menag) Fachrul Razi mengatakan sebagian besar pelajar di Indonesia mendukung aksi radikalisme berbasis agama. Hal itu Fachrul sampaikan pada pembukaan Kemah Pemuda Lintas Paham Keagamaan Islam di Hotel Aryaduta, Tangerang Selatan, Banten, Rabu (6/11).Fachrul mengutip survei Lembaga Kajian Islam dan Perdamaian (Lakip) yang menyatakan 52 persen pelajar setuju dengan aksi radikalisme. Survei itu pernah dipublikasikan pada tahun 2010 hingga 2011."Tingginya tingkat kesetujuan kaum pelajar akan aksi atau tindakan radikal memasuki angka yang sangat mengkhawatirkan. Berdasarkan hasil Survei Lembaga Kajian Islam dan Perdamaian bahwa hampir 52 persen pelajar menyetujui aksi atau tindakan radikal di Indonesia," kata Fachrul.Survei tersebut juga diunggah situs resmi Lembaga Ilmu Pengetahuan Indonesia, lipi.go.id. Survei itu mencatat hampir 50 persen pelajar setuju tindakan radikal. Sebanyak 52,3 persen siswa setuju dengan kekerasan untuk solidaritas agama dan 14,2 persen membenarkan serangan bom.Survei tersebut juga menyebut 25 persen siswa dan 21 persen guru menyatakan Pancasila tak lagi relevan. Kemudian data juga merekam ada 84,8 persen siswa dan 76,2 persen guru setuju dengan penerapan syariat Islam di Indonesia.Dalam pidatonya, Fachrul juga menyatakan keprihatinan bahwa kaum muda usia 17 tahun hingga 35 tahun terlibat aksi terorisme. Ia menjabarkan beberapa kasus, yaitu Bom Bali I, Bom Bali II, Bom Kuningan, Bom Masjid Polres Cirebon dan Bom Thamrin.Fachrul berpesan ke peserta acara bahwa pemuda harus menjadi penentu nasib bangsa, bukan menjadi beban atau inti masalah bangsa."Sungguh sebuah pekerjaan rumah yang perlu kita perhatikan dan untuk kita mewaspadai bersama, karena jika tidak maka fakta-fakta tersebut di atas justru dapat mengubah jalan kedamaian yang selama ini melekat pada tradisi dan kehidupan berbangsa kita," kata mantan Wakil Panglima TNI itu. (dhf)

Minister of Religion: Survey Results, 52 Percent of Students Agree Radicalism
Nov 6 2019, 20:57 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi. (CNN Indonesia / Feri Agus Setyawan).

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Minister of Religion (Menag) Fachrul Razi said most students in Indonesia supported religious-based radicalism. This was conveyed by Fachrul at the opening of the Islamic Youth Interfaith Youth Camp at the Aryaduta Hotel, South Tangerang, Banten, Wednesday (6/11). Fachrul cited a survey of the Islamic Studies and Peace Institute (Lakip) which stated 52 percent of students agreed with radicalism. The survey was published in 2010 to 2011. "The high level of student agreement on radical actions entered a very alarming number. Based on the survey results of the Islamic Studies and Peace Institute that almost 52 percent of students agreed to radical actions or actions in Indonesia," said The Fachrul.Survei was also uploaded on the official website of the Indonesian Institute of Sciences, lipi.go.id. The survey noted that nearly 50 percent of students agreed to radical action. As many as 52.3 percent of students agreed with violence for religious solidarity and 14.2 percent justified bomb attacks. The survey also said 25 percent of students and 21 percent of teachers said Pancasila was no longer relevant. Then the data also recorded there were 84.8 percent of students and 76.2 percent of teachers agreed with the implementation of Islamic law in Indonesia. In his speech, Fachrul also expressed concern that young people aged 17 to 35 years were involved in acts of terrorism. He explained a number of cases, namely the Bali Bombing I, Bali Bombing II, Kuningan Bombing, the Cirebon Mosque Bomb Bombing and Thamrin Bombing. Fachrul advised the event participants that youth must be a determinant of the nation's destiny, not become a burden or the core of the nation's problems. a house that we need to pay attention to and we are to watch out for together, because if not then the facts mentioned above can actually change the path of peace that has been inherent in our national tradition and life, "said the former Deputy Commander of the TNI.
